definitions.definition: causing a lot of angry public discussion and disagreement

examples.text: one of the most controversial of London’s new office blocks
A controversial plan to build a new road has met with protests.
Winston Churchill and Richard Nixon were both controversial figures.
Her controversial new play sparked a riot outside the theatre.
It is one of the most controversial of London's new office buildings.

wordOrigin: late 16th cent.: from late Latin controversialis, from controversia, from controversus ‘turned against, disputed’, from contro- (variant of contra- ‘against’) + versus, past participle of vertere ‘to turn’.
